article_title: San Miguel Sells Stake in Philippine Airlines
article_text:
MANILA—San Miguel Corp., the Philippines' biggest company by sales, has unloaded its stake in Philippine Airlines, the country's national flag carrier.

Ramon Ang, San Miguel's president and chief operating officer, confirmed in a text message on Monday that he had agreed to sell the company's minority stake in Philippine Airlines for "more than $1 billion" to LT Group, the same company it paid $500 million for its interest...
